title: JBP Paint launches 1st recycled paint in Thailand 'JBP Good Paint Re-Acrylic' with 'Sustainable Wellbeing' concept - Nation Thailand
summary: The JBP Good Paint Re-Acrylic collaborative recycled paint was developed by a synergy of four strategic partners under the “One World: One Future Together” project. The new collaborative recycled paint is an innovative product developed in line with the circular economy principle. It does not only help reduce the use of material and components for manufacturing new paints, but also reduce industrial waste.

title: Agriculture Technology-as-a-Service Global Market Report 2023: Decreasing Agriculture Workforce Drives Demand - GlobeNewswire
summary: The global agriculture technology-as-a-service (ATaaS) market is projected to reach $3,438.6 million by 2027, driven by increasing demand for precision agriculture solutions from small-scale farmers. ATaaS provides farmers with advanced and efficient solutions to manage their operations, resulting in improved yields and lower costs. Several leading companies are driving innovation in the ATaaS market, including Deere & Company, Topcon, and Hexagon Agriculture.

title: The challenges and opportunities to verify recycled content in plastic packaging - Circular Online
summary: Recycled Content Verification Systems (RCVS) are designed to give confidence to purchasers of plastic packaging that claimed levels of recycled content are accurate. A Recycled Content Verification Framework is recommended to ensure consistent reporting, international recognition, annual audits, affordability, credibility, value-add, and monitoring of scientific laboratory-based testing technology. Investment in UK's plastic packaging recycling infrastructure is crucial for waste tracking and simplifying the chain of custody approach.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes a Recycled Content Verification Framework that would promote the use of recycled content in plastic packaging, reduce reliance on virgin plastic, and support a circular economy.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article describes a Recycled Content Verification Framework that would introduce a consistent and credible approach to verifying recycled content in plastic packaging.
green_product: TRUE. The article discusses the importance of using recycled content in plastic packaging to reduce the environmental impact of plastic packaging.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe a specific green process.
